intro: Tithymalus persepolitanus, commonly known as the Persian tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white or pale yellow blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Tithymalus persepolitanus thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant in temperate climates.
